page.title: 20Railway Bridges.
page.content: At the moment the railway line between Liverpool Street Station, London, and Norwich is being electrified. This means that the{St. John's Bridge}has had to be rebuilt. St. John's Road was closed from Christmas 1983 to March 1984 so that this work could be carried out. The contractors were May and Gurney.{Parsons Heath Bridge}also had to be rebuilt, this time because it was unsafe as trains were clipping the inside of the bridge. They started the Parsons Heath bridge in September 1984 and hope to finish in the summer of 1985. The rebuilding will cost Â£500,000. The most important construction vehicles being used are the cranes because they can break up the road and carry heavy objects. There are 16 men, working 7 days a week, day and night.
